required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ALKS 5461 for the Treatment of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) - the FORWARD-3 Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Efficacy and Safety Study of ALKS 5461 for the Adjunctive Treatment of Major Depressive Disorder (the FORWARD-3 Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of ALKS 5461.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment (Week 6) in the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
primary_outcome.description: The MADRS-10 scale is a clinician-administered questionnaire comprised of 10 items used to measure the severity of MDD symptoms. Scores range from 0 (no apparent symptoms) to 60 (most severe symptoms). Individual questionnaire items include: Apparent Sadness, Reported Sadness, Inner Tension, Reduced Sleep, Reduced Appetite, Concentration Difficulties, Lassitude, Inability to Feel, Pessimistic Thoughts, and Suicidal Thoughts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients Who Exhibited Treatment Response (MADRS-10)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects demonstrating MADRS-10 treatment response, defined as a ≥ 50% reduction in MADRS-10 score from baseline to the end of the efficacy period (week 6).
The proportion of subjects achieving remission, defined as a MADRS-10 score of ≤ 10 at the end of the efficacy period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events (AEs)

intervention.description: Sublingual tablet, taken once daily (in addition to open-label treatment with a commercially available antidepressant)
Sublingual tablet, taken once daily (in addition to open-label treatment with a commercially available antidepressant)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a Body Mass Index (BMI) of 18.0 to 40.0 kg/m2, inclusive
- Agree to use an acceptable method of contraception for the duration of the study
- Have a Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) primary diagnosis
- Have no more than 2 inadequate responses to antidepressant therapy (ADT) in the current Major Depressive Episode (MDE)
- Additional criteria may apply
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a current primary Axis-I disorder other than MDD
- Have used opioid agonists (eg, codeine, oxycodone, tramadol, morphine) or opioid antagonists (eg, naloxone, naltrexone) within 14 days
- Have received electroconvulsive therapy treatment within the last 2 years or received more than one course of electroconvulsive treatment during lifetime
- Have attempted suicide within the past 2 years
- Have a positive test for drugs of abuse
- Are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding
- Have a history of intolerance, allergy, or hypersensitivity to buprenorphine or opioid antagonists (eg, naltrexone, naloxone)
- Have had a significant blood loss or blood donation within 60 days
- Additional criteria may apply

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were diagnosed with major depressive disorder (MDD) and had an inadequate response to 1 or 2 adequate courses of treatment with a commercially available antidepressant therapy (ADT) during the current major depressive episode (MDE). All subjects continued ADT for the duration of the study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 2 cohorts of subjects were enrolled: Group 1- subjects with baseline HAM-D17 score ≥ 20; Group 2- subjects with baseline HAM-D17 score 18-19. Only Group 1 was included in the efficacy analysis. Study included a 4-week pbo run-in period prior to the 6-week treatment period. In Group 1, 102 subjects did not meet criteria for randomization.

baseline.population: Baseline data is presented for all subjects randomized to treatment. Data from 1 site (18 subjects) was excluded due to data integrity concerns.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment (Week 6) in the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
outcome.description: The MADRS-10 scale is a clinician-administered questionnaire comprised of 10 items used to measure the severity of MDD symptoms. Scores range from 0 (no apparent symptoms) to 60 (most severe symptoms). Individual questionnaire items include: Apparent Sadness, Reported Sadness, Inner Tension, Reduced Sleep, Reduced Appetite, Concentration Difficulties, Lassitude, Inability to Feel, Pessimistic Thoughts, and Suicidal Thoughts.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) consists of subjects in the Group 1 Safety Population who have at least 1 post-randomization assessment of MADRS total score.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment (Week 6) in the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
measure.description: The MADRS-10 scale is a clinician-administered questionnaire comprised of 10 items used to measure the severity of MDD symptoms. Scores range from 0 (no apparent symptoms) to 60 (most severe symptoms). Individual questionnaire items include: Apparent Sadness, Reported Sadness, Inner Tension, Reduced Sleep, Reduced Appetite, Concentration Difficulties, Lassitude, Inability to Feel, Pessimistic Thoughts, and Suicidal Thoughts.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) consists of subjects in the Group 1 Safety Population who have at least 1 post-randomization assessment of MADRS total score.

outcome.title: Proportion of Patients Who Exhibited Treatment Response (MADRS-10)
outcome.description: The proportion of subjects demonstrating MADRS-10 treatment response, defined as a ≥ 50% reduction in MADRS-10 score from baseline to the end of the efficacy period (week 6).
outcome.population: The FAS consists of subjects in the Group 1 Safety Population who have at least 1 post-randomization assessment of MADRS total score.

measure.title: Proportion of Patients Who Exhibited Treatment Response (MADRS-10)
measure.description: The proportion of subjects demonstrating MADRS-10 treatment response, defined as a ≥ 50% reduction in MADRS-10 score from baseline to the end of the efficacy period (week 6).
measure.population: The FAS consists of subjects in the Group 1 Safety Population who have at least 1 post-randomization assessment of MADRS total score.

outcome.title: Remission Rate
outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving remission, defined as a MADRS-10 score of ≤ 10 at the end of the efficacy period.
outcome.population: The FAS consists of subjects in the Group 1 Safety Population who have at least 1 post-randomization assessment of MADRS total score.

measure.title: Remission Rate
measure.description: The proportion of subjects achieving remission, defined as a MADRS-10 score of ≤ 10 at the end of the efficacy period.
measure.population: The FAS consists of subjects in the Group 1 Safety Population who have at least 1 post-randomization assessment of MADRS total score.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.population: Safety population consisted of subjects who were identified as placebo non-responders at the end of the double-blind placebo run-in period and received at least one dose of randomized study drug (ie, placebo or ALKS 5461) subsequent to randomization.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.population: Safety population consisted of subjects who were identified as placebo non-responders at the end of the double-blind placebo run-in period and received at least one dose of randomized study drug (ie, placebo or ALKS 5461) subsequent to randomization.

reported_events.time_frame: AE reporting includes the 6-week double-blind, placebo-controlled period.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Should an Investigator desire to disclose study results, Sponsor will review the results disclosure prior to public release and can embargo the disclosure for a period of at least 60 days. Revisions to the disclosure will be negotiated in good faith. For a multicenter study the Investigators agree to publish/publicly present the results together with the other sites for the 12 month period after study results are available unless Sponsor grants written permission in advance.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Pre-specified primary population data are shown. Data from one trial site were excluded as pre-specified due to data integrity concerns (18 subjects). Other excluded subjects did not receive randomized study drug.
